reviews.review: The best MCU movie of all time. The pacing, characters, action, story, and villain were all amazing. I LOVED Thanos in that movie had its amazing how they were able to create such an i depth villain in a movie with over dozen other main characters, but they did!

The good: 
-Amazing action (some of the best in the MCU in my opinion)
-Thanos is a great villain
-Alan Silvestri's score
-The beginning sets up the central conflict REALLY REALLY well.
-The end is so impactful and shocking

Bad: 
-Gets a little bit choppy with all the storylines going on, which leads to less screentime for the characters (though it's not too much of an issue since they're at least interconnected to some capacity).

Verdict: Not a perfect movie, but even casual movie-goers would be most pleased with it.  Good job Anthony and Joe Russo.

Doom laden and miserable shift in tone. The opening scene of murder. torture and futility of struggle set the tone for the entire picture meaning any humour falls between the cracks. Special mention of the ridiculousness of the set piece scene in which superheroes with the ability to single handedly level entire cities resort to charging across a battlefield in lord of the rings style hand to hand combat. Brilliant...
The biggest disappointment in the MCU
One of the best superhero film
Non-stop action. What else is there to say.

A big messy sprawling superhero movie! Though it's not REALLY a superhero movie now, is it? A bunch of superheroes do get together to fight one big nasty guy, but they're not saving anyone, well, mankind, but anyways.. great story, ridiculous amount of characters and subplots though, so you do get somewhat lost
Best comic book movie ever made.

It's an ambitious, well directed and well acted film that is not a mess. Its not an actual film. It's a giant and climactic 3rd act thats 2 hours 30 minutes long.
The achievements outweigh the flaws. Its a 7/10 for me.

"Perfectly balanced" - storytelling, action, and fan service. This movie seamlessly juggles the many Marvel characters and story lines. You can't help but hang at the edge of your seat wondering what's going to happen next. This is a classic. Marvel's "Empire Strikes Back".
